meanings.definition: A condition characterized by the formation of abnormal bone tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that osteoses can cause pain and stiffness in the bones.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the osteoses under a microscope to understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The skeleton at the museum had such severe osteoses that it looked like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of osteoses was as solid as the bones it affected.
meanings.sent5: The x-ray revealed the osteoses in intricate detail, like a map of the bones.

meanings.sent1: In the anatomy class, they discussed the different types of osteoses found in the body.
meanings.sent2: The textbook listed various examples of osteoses seen in medical cases.
meanings.sent3: The collection of skeletons included many osteoses, making it a diverse display.
meanings.sent4: The museum exhibit showcased the beauty of osteoses in all their forms.
meanings.sent5: The doctor's expertise in identifying osteoses was unmatched in the hospital.
